main event: An unidentified flying object was observed in Lothridge, Ohio on March 9, 1967.
interesting points: The object was described as solid and had a brightness comparable to a first magnitude star., The sighting lasted for 11 minutes and the object was noted to have a 'saucer-like' shape., There were no distinct sounds associated with the object., The observer compared the colors of the object to dark gray., The official conclusion of the Air Force was 'insufficient data for evaluation.'
sighted object: a solid object with bright lights
witness description: a couple driving down a country road
